body: @socketpair This error comes from https://github.com/golang/go/blob/72c52bfbe2f72fbcacc865e18f132366bdd2effa/src/bufio/scan.go#L70. I don't see any place using bufio.Scanner. What command did you try?
I connect to etcd via websocket (grpc gateway)

Can you check it on v3.5 release? I'm not sure if zap logging was considered fully stable in v3.4. 
cc @ahrtr to consider for v3.4 release

I don't remember exact sequence to reproduce. But anyway, ALL other libraries like grpc gateway need also be switched to zap logger, doesn't it?

At least, the following should be done (pseudocode):

Zap.set_fd(dup(2))

nullfd = open(/dev/null)
dup2(nullfd, 2)
close(nullfd)

This will guarantee jsons in logging collector even if some lib writes to stderr.

This one is OK: (got from journald transport)
```
дек 10 04:07:23 etcd[800]: {"level":"warn","ts":"2022-12-10T04:07:23.322+0500","caller":"etcdserver/util.go:166","msg":"apply request took too long","took":"102.579815ms","expected-duration":"100ms","prefix":"","request":"header:<ID:7587867152>
```

These are from GRPC gateway embeeded (got from systemd's stdout transport). Maybe from stderr, I don't know.
```
дек 10 04:07:48 etcd[800]: time="2022-12-10T04:07:48+05:00" level=warning msg="error reading websocket message: read tcp 127.0.0.1:2379->127.0.0.1:57042: read: connection reset by peer"
дек 10 04:07:48 etcd[800]: time="2022-12-10T04:07:48+05:00" level=warning msg="error reading websocket message: websocket: close 1006 (abnormal closure): unexpected EOF"
дек 10 04:13:50 etcd[800]: time="2022-12-10T04:13:50+05:00" level=warning msg="error reading websocket message: websocket: close 1006 (abnormal closure): unexpected EOF"
дек 10 04:13:50 etcd[800]: time="2022-12-10T04:13:50+05:00" level=warning msg="error reading websocket message: websocket: close 1006 (abnormal closure): unexpected EOF"
```


GRPC gateway must use zap logger internally.

```
# etcd --version
etcd Version: 3.5.0
Git SHA: Not provided (use ./build instead of go build)
Go Version: go1.16.6
Go OS/Arch: linux/amd64
```
